Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class UltrasonicLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.UltrasonicLocalizer
  • public class UltrasonicLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that reads the ultrasonic sensor data and allows the robot to correct its heading towards 0 when near 2 walls.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static boolean detected
      Is the robot facing a wall
      private static int DIST
      Arbitrary constant used to find the heading
      private static double heading
      Heading of the robot
      private static int invalidSampleCount
      The number of invalid samples seen by filter() so far.
      private static int K
      Noise margin
      private static int prevDistance
      The distance remembered by the filter() method.
      private static double thetaMin
      Min angle between 2 walls
      private static float[] usData
      Buffer (array) to store US samples.

      • UltrasonicLocalizer

    • Method Detail

      • localize

        public static void localize()
        If facing the wall the method detects a rising edge and a falling edge and calculates the heading. When facing away from the wall the same principle is applied except it detects 2 falling edges

      • readUsDistance

        public static int readUsDistance()
        Returns:
        the filtered distance between the US sensor and an obstacle in cm.

      • filter

        static int filter​(int distance)
        Rudimentary filter - toss out invalid samples corresponding to null signal.
        Parameters:
        distance - raw distance measured by the sensor in cm
        Returns:
        the filtered distance in cm
